name: lab journal-Higgs
description: Stamped with at least a dozen security labels, this textbook-sized book houses the technical specifications and blueprints for several devices and tools mentioning the 'subprime planes.'  Some of the notes written in the margins have... frightening portent.

name: extradimensional pack
description: An unfathomably complicated machine held by sturdy faux-leather straps, meant to be worn like a backpack.  A hatch on the top can be used to store items in an extradimensional space.  How this works without annihilating spacetime isn't quite clear, but internal safeties restrict the amount stored to a modest amount.

name: m/e interface
description: This small, innocuous all-in-one computer terminal contains esoteric hardware and programming that allows it to maintain a localized connection to an extraplanar space using teleportation technology developed before the Cataclysm.

name: cryotic m/e interface
description: This small, innocuous all-in-one computer terminal contains esoteric hardware and programming that allows it to maintain a localized connection to a chilly extraplanar space using teleportation technology developed before the Cataclysm.

name: cryogenic m/e interface
description: This small, innocuous all-in-one computer terminal contains esoteric hardware and programming that allows it to maintain a localized connection to a freezing extraplanar space using teleportation technology developed before the Cataclysm.

name: vacuum turbine
description: A modest-sized, sleek steel surface conceals experimental technology capable of harnessing the power of the subprime.  Though the Cataclysm came before its staggering output of clean energy could be harnessed in society, it still has its uses...
